  "article_text": [
    "recently , the authors investigated the following coding problem @xcite . consider a coding system composed of one encoder and @xmath0 decoders .",
    "the encoder observes the sequence generated by a memoryless source with generic variable @xmath1 .",
    "then , the encoder broadcasts the codeword to the decoders over the noiseless channel with capacity @xmath2 . the purpose of the @xmath3-th decoder is to estimate the value of the target source @xmath4 as accurately as possible by using the side information @xmath5 and the codeword sent by the encoder , where @xmath6 and @xmath7 may be correlated with @xmath1 .",
    "accuracy of the estimation of the @xmath3-th decoder is evaluated by some distortion measure @xmath8 and it is required that the expected distortion is not greater than the given value @xmath9 .",
    "[ fig1 ] depicts the coding system where @xmath10 .    )",
    ".,width=211 ]    in @xcite , we proposed a coding scheme which is _ universal _ in the sense that it attains the optimal rate - distortion tradeoff even if the probability distribution @xmath11 of the source @xmath1 is unknown , while the side informations @xmath6 and the targets @xmath7 are assumed to be generated from @xmath1 via a known memoryless channel . in @xcite , we considered only stationary and memoryless sources . in this paper , we extend the result of @xcite to the case where sources are stationary and ergodic sources .",
    "as mentioned in @xcite , our coding problem described above includes various problems as special cases .",
    "for example , the wyner - ziv problem , i.e.  the rate - distortion problem with side information at the decoder @xcite , is a special case of our problem , where @xmath12 and @xmath13 .",
    "a variation of the wyner - ziv problem , where the side information may fail to reach the decoder @xcite , is also included as a special case , where @xmath14 , @xmath15 , @xmath16 and @xmath17 ( see fig .  [ fig3 ] ) .",
    "moreover , our coding system can be considered as a generalization of the complementary delivery @xcite .",
    "in fact , a simple complementary delivery problem depicted in fig .  [ fig2 ] is the case where @xmath14 , @xmath18 , @xmath19 , @xmath20 , and @xmath21 ( @xmath22 ) .",
    "further , our coding problem includes also the problem considered in @xcite ( depicted in fig .",
    "[ fig4 ] ) as a special case , where @xmath14 , @xmath23 , @xmath24 ( @xmath22 ) , and @xmath25 .",
    "at first , we introduce some notations . we denote by @xmath26 the set of positive integers @xmath27 . for a set @xmath28 and an integer @xmath29",

    "further , we assume that @xmath49 is _ known _ both to the encoder and decoders , while @xmath39 is unknown .",
    "universal wyner - ziv coding in a setting similar to ours is considered in @xcite . ] . in other words ,",

    "then , the formal definition of a code for our coding system is given as follows .",

    "@xmath77 is defined by mappings @xmath78 and @xmath79 @xmath80 is called the _ encoder _ and @xmath81 is called the _",

    "now , we state our main result .",
    "the theorem clarifies that , whenever @xmath92 is achievable , @xmath92 is also achievable universally .",
    "[ maintheorem ] for given @xmath92 and @xmath98 , there exists a sequence @xmath99 of codes which is universally optimal in the following sense : for any source @xmath39 for which @xmath92 is achievable there exists @xmath100 such that , for any @xmath101 , @xmath102 satisfies @xmath103 and @xmath104\\leq\\delta_j+\\delta\\ ] ] for any @xmath45 .",
    "the proof of the theorem will be given in the next section .",
    "let @xmath92 and @xmath98 be given .",

    "2 .   send @xmath118 and @xmath120 by using @xmath135 bits .",
    "send the index of decoders @xmath136 by using @xmath137 bits .",
    "send the codewords @xmath138 of blocks @xmath139 ( @xmath140 ) encoded by @xmath141 . *",
    "_ decoder @xmath142 : _ the @xmath3-the decoder decodes the received codeword as follows . 1 .",
    "decode the first @xmath135 bits of the received codeword and obtain @xmath118 and @xmath120 .",
    "2 .   decode the first @xmath137 bits of the remaining part of the received codeword and obtain the decoders @xmath136 chosen by the encoder .",
    "3 .   decode the remaining part of the received codeword by using @xmath143 and the side information @xmath144 .",

    "s.  kuzuoka , a.  kimura , and t.  uyematsu , `` universal source coding for multiple decoders with side information , '' in _ proc .",
    "of 2010 ieee international symposium on information theory ( isit2010 ) _ , to appear .",
    "e.  perron , s.  diggavi , and i.  telatar , `` on the role of encoder side - information in source coding for multiple decoders , '' in _ proc .",
    "of 2006 ieee international symposium on information theory _ , jul .",
    "2006 , pp . 331335 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> a multiterminal lossy coding problem , which includes various problems such as the wyner - ziv problem and the complementary delivery problem as special cases , is considered . </S>",
    "<S> it is shown that any point in the achievable rate - distortion region can be attained even if the source statistics are not known . </S>"
  ]
}
